page.title: 10FARMING HARVEY'S DAIRY
page.content: Harvey's dairy has 250 British friesian cattle,3 bulls and the rest are cows.Each cows has 1-10 lactations then they are sold for beef.They have two parlours and two farms,covering 186 hectares of grassland.The cows are milked at5am and 2-3pm,by 4 farm workers. They produce 24,500 pint bottles a week.Also 3,000 cartons of milk and semi skimmed milk plus 1,800 pints of sterilised milk. The milk is delivered at 3 am-4am to midday by 8 milkmen who cover twelve villages. Harvey's have 4 processors at the bottling plant.The surplus milk goes to the Milk Marketing Board. Harvey's Dairy was started by Gerald Harvey with 2 cows at the White Bull, Coningsby 60 years ago and moved to the present site 20 years later.There are 3 office workers.
